title: Software Engineering Tips for Students
description:
I did a presentation for the Computational Linguistics MS program orientation at UW, and consolidated the speaker notes into a blog post.

I‚Äôm open to feedback and thoughts here! I tried to keep it fairly general, since some students are coming in with a linguistics background and more limited programming experience, while other students come from a CS background.

I also tried to present in the context of ‚Äúyou will probably have a deadline, don‚Äôt worry about 100% test coverage, but testing will still help if you cover the main functionality at least‚Äù.

I was considering adding more examples, but wasn‚Äôt sure if it‚Äôs already too long-winded.
description_plain:
I did a presentation for the Computational Linguistics MS program orientation at UW, and consolidated the speaker notes into a blog post.

I'm open to feedback and thoughts here! I tried to keep it fairly general, since some students are coming in with a linguistics background and more limited programming experience, while other students come from a CS background.

I also tried to present in the context of "you will probably have a deadline, don't worry about 100% test coverage, but testing will still help if you cover the main functionality at least".

I was considering adding more examples, but wasn't sure if it's already too long-winded.
